channel.title: I added Dr. Magnusson to the game.
channel.description:
So, I was playing through Anomalous Materials for the 500th time when I stumbled into the Sector C break room and blew up a man's casserole because [s]I'm a psychotic, bloodthirsty individual[/s]I was bored. The two other occupants lament on my action, and brace for the soon-incoming Dr. Magnusson's [s]slave[/s] assistant, who has been ordered to retrieve his meal. The assistant, not wanting to incur the wrath of a short Caucasian man, begins the long journey back to [s]Magnusson's lair[/s] the lab he and Magnusson work in, right above where Drs. Vance and Kleiner work. He walks in to the lab, informs Magnusson that his food is ready, and begins to act busy. The rest is history.
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=834256899&searchtext=magnusson[/url]
Download it and tell me what you think.

item.title: I added Dr. Magnusson to the game.
item.dc:creator: Twilightwolf4
item.description:
According to Half-Life 2 Episode Two’s commentary, the scientist who says "Gordon doesn’t need to hear all this, he’s a highly-trained professional. We’ve assured the Administrator that nothing will go wrong." prior to entering the Test Chamber was Dr. Magnusson

Read full topic
item.source: I added Dr. Magnusson to the game.

item.title: I added Dr. Magnusson to the game.
item.dc:creator: ToastyToast
item.description:
So, I was playing through Anomalous Materials for the 500th time when I stumbled into the Sector C break room and blew up a man’s casserole because I’m a psychotic, bloodthirsty individualI was bored. The two other occupants lament on my action, and brace for the soon-incoming Dr. Magnusson’s slave assistant, who has been ordered to retrieve his meal. The assistant, not wanting to incur the wrath of a short Caucasian man, begins the long journey back to Magnusson’s lair the lab he and Magnusson work in, right above where Drs. Vance and Kleiner work. He walks in to the lab, informs Magnusson that his food is ready, and begins to act busy. The rest is history.
